Description: Base and body of a (child’s) head flask, mould-blown, janiform (double-faced) Neck and rim not preserved. Glass is of natural blue-greenish colour with iridescence (bright-green and gold).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From Naukratis. 1886-7: excavated by William Matthew Flinders Petrie for the Egypt Exploration Fund, assigned to the EEF by the Egyptian government; December 22, 1887, presented to the MFA by the EEF. (Accession date: 1888).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FE.06)
